intro: Cyphostemma shinyangense, commonly known as the Shinyangensis moonvine, is a climbing plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, horn-like fruits. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique morphology, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
